p: The World Health Organization recommends IPT/TB Preventive Treatment (TPT) to treat tuberculous infection in high-risk populations, such as persons living with human immunodeficiency virus (PLHIV) and children aged 5Â years who are close contacts of patients with infectious TB [ 4]. In 2014, Uganda adopted the WHO guidelines for Intensified TB Case finding (ICF) and IPT/TPT as part of the comprehensive HIV/AIDS care strategy [ 5].
